modName: Zoners Realistic Lighting and Imaginator settings
summary: Bright and vibrant lighting settings for Skyrim with a zero FPS hit!
descriptionHtml:
[size=5][color=4169E1][b][u]Introduction[/u][/b][/color][/size]
These are my custom settings for RL and Imaginator as a combo.
Since both RL and Imaginator use only the ingame engine, the FPS hit is zero.
All feedback is appreciated, especially on issues surrounding bright areas and bloom!

[size=5][color=4169E1][b][u]Prerequisites[/u][/b][/color][/size]
You must have [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7654]Realistic Lighting with Customization[/url] and [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=13049]Imaginator[/url] installed in order to achieve the same effects as in the screenshots. I also recommend using [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=12525]Dynavision[/url] as it has some very cool DoF effects!

[size=5][color=4169E1][b][u]Installation[/u][/b][/color][/size]
[list][*]Copy the \"Realisticlightingpatcher.esp\" to your data folder
[*]Copy \"Realisticlighting.ini\" to the data folder if you want to customize the INI (Backup your INI first!)
[*]In the load order; make sure that Realisticlightingpatcher.esp loads AFTER (below) Realisticlighting.esp
[*]Launch skyrim!
[/list]
 
[size=5][color=4169E1][b][u]Imaginator Settings[/u][/b][/color][/size]
Within the game summon the Imaginator helper and \"Reset All Adjustments\" from the main menu of the Imaginator helper (just in case)
Then apply the following settings through the helper:
[list][*]In the [u]PRESET SETTINGS MENU[/u]; apply \'Warm Northern Lights\', \'Pop Photo Shoot\' and \'Nice overall enhancement\' [u]one time each[/u].
[*]In the [u]TINTOR MENU[/u]; add Yellow and Orange [u]one time each[/u].
[*]In the [u]CONTRASTOR MENU[/u]; adjust Contrast; Saturation and Brightness to taste, my personal settings are, Contrast around default; Saturation around -15; Brightness is default.
[*]I keep the ingame brightness around 3 notches below the midpoint; adjust according to your taste.
[*]If certain areas hit by the sun appear too bright, lower the \'Sunlight\' value under the CINEMAGIC menu in Imaginator
[/list]

[size=5][color=4169E1][b][u]Dynavision Settings[/u][/b][/color][/size]
I have never been able to make the Dynamic DoF work well; so i use the STATIC DoF with the strength set to High.

[size=5][color=4169E1][b][u]Version History[/u][/b][/color][/size]
[list][*]Version 1.1: Added a low bloom to the RL ini, so bloom need not be applied through Imaginator. Leads to a lower overall bloom setting.
[*]Version 1.0: Initial Version
[/list]

[size=5][color=4169E1][b][u]Other lighting Mods that I use[/u][/b][/color][/size]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11336]Lanterns of Skyrim-Bridges[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=12451]Lanterns of Skyrim-Cities[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10206]Cozier Villages - Outdoor Lighting[/url]

[size=5][color=4169E1][b][u]Credits[/u][/b][/color][/size]
Plutoman101 for Realistic Lighting
MGE for Imaginator
Gopher for Dynavision
